Parameter.name: Output for Buzzer on Extender
Parameter.Help: Output connected to the buzzer on the Extender
Parameter.Notes: This is the output that is connected to the buzzer on the Extender

Parameter.name: Aux Port Baudrate
Parameter.Help: Aux Port Baudrate
Parameter.Notes: Aux Port Baudrate: 300...9600...115200

Parameter.name: Aux Port Configuration
Parameter.Help: Aux Port Configuration
Parameter.Notes: Aux Port Configuration Parameter. 0 - Standard 81 Protocol Port 1 - Custom Functionality 1 n - Custom Functionality n 255 - NMEA Port

Parameter.name: Card Reader control immobilization
Parameter.Help: When a valid card is read the vehicle is de-immobilized
Parameter.Notes: When a valid card is read the vehicle is de-immobilized

Parameter.name: Card Reader Dangerous Goods control immobilization
Parameter.Help: When a valid card is read and the license type indicate dangerous goods the vehicle is de-immobilized
Parameter.Notes: When a valid card is read and the license type indicate dangerous goods the vehicle is de-immobilized

Parameter.name: Card Reader Driver ID
Parameter.Help: Driver ID to be used when de-immobilizing a vehicle with a card
Parameter.Notes: Driver ID to be used when de-immobilizing a vehicle with a card

Parameter.name: Clear Fuel Flow Counts on Event
Parameter.Help: Clear the Fuel Flow Meter Count values when the event is generated
Parameter.Notes: Clear the Fuel Flow Meter Count values when the event is generated

Parameter.name: Customer Field 1
Parameter.Help: Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions.
Parameter.Notes: Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions.

Parameter.name: Customer Field 2
Parameter.Help: Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions.
Parameter.Notes: Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions.

Parameter.name: Customer Field 3
Parameter.Help: Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions.
Parameter.Notes: Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions.

Parameter.name: Customer Field 4
Parameter.Help: Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions.
Parameter.Notes: Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions.

Parameter.name: Enable IPC
Parameter.Help: Enable the IPC comms to the MHub Extender
Parameter.Notes: Enable the IPC comms to the MHub Extender

Parameter.name: Enable Weight Sensor on Analog 1
Parameter.Help: Enable Weight Sensor on Analog Input 1
Parameter.Notes: Enable Weight Sensor on Analog Input 1

Parameter.name: ERM Relay ID
Parameter.Help: ERM Remote Relay ID
Parameter.Notes: The ID of the ERM Remote Relay

Parameter.name: Fuel Data Event at End of Trip
Parameter.Help: Send the Fuel Data event at the end of a trip
Parameter.Notes: Send the Fuel Data event at the end of a trip

Parameter.name: Fuel Data Event at Start of Trip
Parameter.Help: Send the Fuel Data event at the start of a trip
Parameter.Notes: Send the Fuel Data event at the start of a trip

Parameter.name: Fuel Data Event on Cap Status Change
Parameter.Help: Send the Fuel Data event at when the status of the Fuel Cap status changed
Parameter.Notes: Send the Fuel Data event at when the status of the Fuel Cap status changed

Parameter.name: Fuel Data Fuel Level Event
Parameter.Help: Fuel Data Fuel Level Event
Parameter.Notes: Fuel Data Fuel Level Event will generate OBD2 Fuel Level event and overwrite CANBus Fuel Level.

Parameter.name: Garmin Fleet Functions
Parameter.Help: 0 Garmin Fleet Function disabled 1 Garmin Fleet Function enabled
Parameter.Notes: 0 Garmin Fleet Function disabled 1 Garmin Fleet Function enabled

Parameter.name: Global Pass-through enable
Parameter.Help: Global Pass-through enable
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Set Global Pass-through enable. 1 to enable Modem, GPS, Acc, OBD2,Sim passthrough modes 2 to enable CAN Socket Passthrough

Parameter.name: IO Expander Installed
Parameter.Help: The IO Expander have been installed and connected to the MHub
Parameter.Notes: Enable communications with the IO Expander that would give the unit an extra 8 Inputs, 4 Outputs and 2 Analog Inputs. It is important to note that the IO Expander is an external device connected to the MHub.

Parameter.name: Maximum Vehicle Carry Weight
Parameter.Help: Maximum weight that the vehicle can carry
Parameter.Notes: Maximum weight that the vehicle can carry. Used for calibration of the weight sensor connected to Analog input 1

Parameter.name: Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip End
Parameter.Help: Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip End
Parameter.Notes: Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip End

Parameter.name: Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip Start
Parameter.Help: Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip Start
Parameter.Notes: Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip Start

Parameter.name: Vehicle Info Event Mask
Parameter.Help: Vehicle Info Event Mask
Parameter.Notes: Vehicle Info Event Mask: To get configuration value calculate the total value by adding the individual event values together. A value of 65535 will enable all events and 0 will disable all events. Mobileye Brakes 1 Mobileye Left Indicator 2 Mobileye Right Indicator 4 Mobileye Wipers 8 Mobileye Low Beam 16 Mobileye High Beam 32 Mobileye Tamper 64 Mobileye No Comms 128

Parameter.name: Weight Sensor Calibration Vector
Parameter.Help: Weight Sensor Calibration Vector
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Weight Sensor Calibration Vector

Parameter.name: Weight Sensor Data Interval
Parameter.Help: This is the interval in seconds between successive Weight Sensor Events.
Parameter.Notes: This is the interval in seconds between successive Weight Sensor Events. 0 disables the feature

Parameter.name: Config Version Info
Parameter.Help: This can be used to indicated version information regarding the configuration that was used
Parameter.Notes: This can be used to indicated version information regarding the configuration that was used. Eg. Default V01

Parameter.name: Enable All Debug
Parameter.Help: Switch all debug statements ON or OFF
Parameter.Notes: The value represents the debug time-out in minutes. Setting the value to 255 is a special case causing the debugs to be permanently active.

Parameter.name: Enable Error Debug Messages
Parameter.Help: Enable Error Debug Messages
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Error Debug messages

Parameter.name: Enable Info Debug Messages
Parameter.Help: Enable Info Debug Messages
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Info Debug messages

Parameter.name: Enable Warning Debug Messages
Parameter.Help: Enable Warning Debug Messages
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Warning Debug messages

Parameter.name: Module Debug Mask
Parameter.Help: Enable debug statements for a specific Module
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: Module Debug Mask 2
Parameter.Help: Enable debug statements for specific modules - set 2
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: Module Debug Mask 3
Parameter.Help: Enable debug statements for specific modules - set 3
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: Module Debug Mask 4
Parameter.Help: Enable debug statements for specific modules - set 4
Parameter.Notes: None

Parameter.name: Trace Level
Parameter.Help: This is the level of trace information that would be sent to the debug port
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

Parameter.name: Driver Key Type
Parameter.Help: The Driver Key Type indicates what kind of Driver Key device is allowed to be used for Driver Identification and vehicle immobilization. Values: 0,8,255 = Standard DS1992 based Scope Driver Key initialized properly using the Scope Driver Key programmer software. 1 = DS1990 where Bytes 1 and 2 of the device serial number is used as the Driver ID 170 = ScopeID where the device ID contains the Driver ID, Fleet Code and Vehicle Class All other values are reserved
Parameter.Notes: The Driver Key Type indicates what kind of Driver Key device is allowed to be used for Driver Identification and vehicle immobilization. Values: 0,8 = Standard DS1992 based Scope Driver Key initialized properly using the Scope Driver Key programmer software. 1 = DS1990 where Bytes 1 and 2 of the device serial number is used as the Driver ID 170 = ScopeID where the device ID contains the Driver ID, Fleet Code and Vehicle Class 255 = Any supported key All other values are reserved

Parameter.name: Enable Driver Key
Parameter.Help: Driver Key Used
Parameter.Notes: If the driver key is used, then this parameter must be set to 1

Parameter.name: Error Limit
Parameter.Help: Maximum number of accumulated errors before the modem is rebooted
Parameter.Notes: As described in the parameter Reboot Limit, the MHub will issue a reboot command to the modem if it detects a problem with the modem. However if an error is received in response to an instruction to the modem, the MHub will first retry the instruction. This parameter specifies the number of accumulated errors that the MHub can receive from the modem before it will issue a reboot command to the mode.

Parameter.name: Modem No-Network Restart Delay
Parameter.Help: The amount of time that the unit will wait after rebooting the modem before repeating the process.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

Parameter.name: Modem Power Down Recovery Standoff Time
Parameter.Help: If the modem is unable to establish an APN session within the allowed attempts then it will power itself down for the configured number of minutes. The frequency with which this can occur is governed by the Modem Power Down Recovery Interval parameter. Setting this to 0 disables this feature.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
If the modem is unable to establish an APN session within the allowed attempts then it will power itself down for the configured number of minutes. The frequency with which this can occur is governed by the Modem Power Down Recovery Interval parameter. Setting this to 0 disables this feature.

Parameter.name: Ignition OFF Source from Main Voltage Threshold
Parameter.Help: Main Voltage Threshold for Ignition Off if Ignition Source from Main Voltage
Parameter.Notes: When main voltage is used as the source of ignition, this parameter is the voltage threshold below which ignition will be assumed OFF. Typically in a 12V vehicle this should be 13V, the parameter is in 100mv steps, thus the value of the parameter will be 130. Setting this value to 0 switches off this functionality and the unit will fall back to normal ignition off detection.

Parameter.name: Temperature Sensor 1 ID
Parameter.Help: Temperature Sensor 1 ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

Parameter.name: Temperature Sensor 2 ID
Parameter.Help: Temperature Sensor 2 ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

Parameter.name: Temperature Sensor 3 ID
Parameter.Help: Temperature Sensor 3 ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

Parameter.name: Temperature Sensor 4 ID
Parameter.Help: Temperature Sensor 4 ID
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

Parameter.name: Allow Unsolicited CAN Message Parsing
Parameter.Help: Allows the MHub to use MProfiler supplied EOBD data to parse unsolicited vehicle proprietary data. This parameter should be managed by MProfiler.
Parameter.Notes: Allows the MHub to use MProfiler supplied EOBD data to parse unsolicited vehicle proprietary data. This parameter should be managed by MProfiler.

Parameter.name: Enable KWP2000 ISO14230-3
Parameter.Help: Enables the use of the ISO14230-3 Command Set. This should only be enabled on vehicles that are known to support this protocol.
Parameter.Notes: Enables the use of the ISO14230-3 Command Set. This should only be enabled on vehicles that are known to support this protocol.

Parameter.name: Enable UDS/ISO14229
Parameter.Help: Enables UDS/ISO14229 commands sent from XPlatform.
Parameter.Notes: Enables UDS/ISO14229 commands sent from XPlatform.

Parameter.name: EOBD Function Control
Parameter.Help:
Manages how the CAN bus is used by the MHub 0 - Full functionality. Sending and receiving of all EOBD protocols possible 166 [0xA6] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. UNSOLICITED MESSAGES PARSED. No commands sent. 172 [0xAC] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. Full KWP2000, UDS and unsolicited data. Useful for vehicles that do not support ISO15031.
Do not enable this if you do not understand the side effects and implications.
Parameter.Notes:
Manages how the CAN bus is used by the MHub 0 - Full functionality. Sending and receiving of all EOBD protocols possible 166 [0xA6] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. UNSOLICITED MESSAGES PARSED. No commands sent. 172 [0xAC] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. Full KWP2000, UDS and unsolicited data. Useful for vehicles that do not support ISO15031.
Do not enable this if you do not understand the side effects and implications.

Parameter.name: Lock Fake VIN for EOBD Data Requests
Parameter.Help: Prevents the use of the read vehicle VIN for requesting EOBD data. If Fake VIN is programmed then only this will be used to request data.
Parameter.Notes: Prevents the use of the read vehicle VIN for requesting EOBD data. If Fake VIN is programmed then only this will be used to request data.

Parameter.name: Pseudo (Fake) VIN
Parameter.Help: Used for requesting a parameter set from XPlatform that will be used to retrieve the true VIN from a particular vehicle type. Note: The length of the VIN must be 13 characters otherwise XPlatform will reject the ID. The ID supplied here will be prefaced with PSD_ to safeguard against accidental VIN entry.
Parameter.Notes: Used for requesting a parameter set from XPlatform that will be used to retrieve the true VIN from a particular vehicle type. Note: The length of the VIN must be 13 characters otherwise XPlatform will reject the ID. The ID supplied here will be prefaced with PSD_ to safeguard against accidental VIN entry.

Parameter.name: J1939 Filter Disable
Parameter.Help: J1939 Filter Disable
Parameter.Notes: J1939 Filter Disable will allow all CANBus messages to be received from the bus

Parameter.name: Enable OBD2 Login on CAN activity
Parameter.Help: Allows the initialisation of OBD when CAN activity is detected. Note: Needs Listen Only mode to be enabled to work.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Allows the initialisation of OBD when CAN activity is detected. Note: Needs Listen Only mode to be enabled to work.

Parameter.name: OBD2 Lockout
Parameter.Help: OBD2 Lockout time in seconds
Parameter.Notes: OBD2 Lockout time in seconds. If the MHub detects a scantool trying to log into CanBus the MHub will stand off for the Lockout period in seconds. Maximum of 254 seconds. Values of 0 and 255 will disable this feature.

Parameter.name: CAN Triggered Standoff Time
Parameter.Help: Sets the number of minutes that the unit will stand off from the CAN bus when a message from an ECU ID corresponding with CAN Standoff Trigger on XPlatform is detected. The intended use is to standoff when another diagnostic tool is detected on the bus.
Parameter.Notes: Sets the number of minutes that the unit will stand off from the CAN bus when a message from an ECU ID corresponding with CAN Standoff Trigger on XPlatform is detected. The intended use is to standoff when another diagnostic tool is detected on the bus.

Parameter.name: Enable CAN Controller Automatic Bus Off
Parameter.Help: Allow the CAN controller to automatically drop off the buss. NB: IT IS HIGHTLY RECOMMENDED NOT TO CHANGE THIS PARAMETER 0xAC (172) - Enable Auto Buss Off 0x53 (83) - Disable Auto Buss Off Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Allow the CAN controller to automatically drop off the buss. NB: IT IS HIGHTLY RECOMMENDED NOT TO CHANGE THIS PARAMETER 0xAC (172) - Enable Auto Buss Off 0x53 (83) - Disable Auto Buss Off Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active.

Parameter.name: Enable CAN Controller Automatic Retries
Parameter.Help: Allow the CAN controller to automatically retry any failed transmissions. On some vehicles this can cause buss interference. 0xAC (172) - Enable Automatic Retries 0x53 (83) - Disable Automatic Retries Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active.
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Allow the CAN controller to automatically retry any failed transmissions. On some vehicles this can cause buss interference. 0xAC (172) - Enable Automatic Retries 0x53 (83) - Disable Automatic Retries Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active.

Parameter.name: Enable J1939 FMS CANBus Interface
Parameter.Help: Enable J1939 FMS CANBus Interface. Note: Enable OBD2 CANBus Interface = 0
Parameter.Notes: If the J1939 FMS CANBus is connected to the MHub828 CANbus, this parameter needs to be set to 1 to enable the CAN Bus functionality. Disable the OBD2 CANbus interface

Parameter.name: Enable Listen Only Mode
Parameter.Help: Enables the controller to go into listen only mode after closing a session. NOTE: This is necessary to recover from some errors
Parameter.Notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Enables the controller to go into listen only mode after closing a session. NOTE: This is necessary to recover from some errors

Parameter.name: Enable Vehicle CANBus Interface
Parameter.Help: Enable Vehicle On Board Diagnostics CANBus Interface Note: Enable J1939 FMS CANBus Interface = 0
Parameter.Notes: Enable ISO15765 Protocol interface using the CANBus interface. Disable the J1939 FMS CANBus Interface.

Parameter.name: Enable Vehicle K Line Interface
Parameter.Help: Enable Vehicle On Board Diagnostics Interface
Parameter.Notes: Enable ISO9141 and ISO14230 network interface using the LIN line

Parameter.name: Enhanced Protocol Selection ID
Parameter.Help:
0 - Use automatic detection for OBD protocols. 6 - Mobile Eye
60 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 61 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Active (Not MHub855) 62 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 63 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Active (Not MHub855)
100 - CAN 500kb / 11-bit OBD requests 129 - CAN 500kb / 29-bit OBD requests 210 - K-Line Fast Initialisation 250 - CAN 250kb / 11-bit 220 - TP2 Instrument 221 - TP2 Engine
All other values default to Mobile Eye Parameter Set
Parameter.Notes:
0 - Use automatic detection for OBD protocols. 6 - Mobile Eye
60 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 61 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Active (Not MHub855) 62 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 63 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Active (Not MHub855)
100 - CAN 500kb / 11-bit OBD requests 129 - CAN 500kb / 29-bit OBD requests 210 - K-Line Fast Initialisation 250 - CAN 250kb / 11-bit 220 - TP2 Instrument 221 - TP2 Engine
All other values default to Mobile Eye Parameter Set

Parameter.name: ISO15765 250kBaud Disable
Parameter.Help: Disable 250kBaud detection.
Parameter.Notes: Disable 250kBaud detection.

Parameter.name: OBC 500kbps J1939 FMS CANBus
Parameter.Help: Verify with vehicle manufacturer if the CANBus should be 500kbps Baudrate before setting this parameter.
Parameter.Notes:
For 250kbps set OBC 500kbps J1939 FMS CANBus = 0, for 500kbps set OBC 500kbps J1939 FMS CANBus = 1.
The FMS Standard specifies the baudrate to be 250kbps.

Parameter.name: OBC Active J1939 FMS CANBus
Parameter.Help: Enable Active J1939 FMS CANBus
Parameter.Notes: Verify with vehicle manufacturer if the CANBus should be Active of Passive before setting this parameter.

Parameter.name: TP 2.0 Enable
Parameter.Help: Enable TP 2.0 Protocol used by VW Group vehicles; VW, Seat, Audi, etc
Parameter.Notes: Enable TP 2.0 Protocol used by VW Group vehicles; VW, Seat, Audi, etc

Parameter.name: VNI Compatibility Mode
Parameter.Help: Relaxes timings on some protocols to enable compatibility with older vehicles.
Parameter.Notes: Relaxes timings on some protocols to enable compatibility with older vehicles.
